Young Adult

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

The White Hare by Michael Fishwick

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Feb 27, 2018

The White Hare is a coming-of-age novel that will especially appeal to fans of myth and folklore

My Side of the Diamond by Sally Gardener

Written by Amélie Magotte · Published Feb 22, 2018

My Side of the Diamond is really exciting and amazingly realistic.

All the Crooked Saints by Maggie Stiefvater

Written by Kate Ashton · Published Feb 20, 2018

All the Crooked Saints is magical, miraculous, haunting, enigmatic, allegorical, fantastical and more.

This Mortal Coil by Emily Suvada

Written by Amélie Magotte · Published Feb 15, 2018

This Mortal Coil is an absolutely brilliant book.

Colin Fischer by Ashley Edward Miller & Zack Stentz

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Feb 13, 2018

Emma recommends Colin Fischer to fans of The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time.

Find your next YA read on the 2018 Waterstones Children's Book Prize shortlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published Feb 8, 2018

This year's shortlist features dark, lusciously-illustrated gothic mysteries and unflinching dramas addressing the real-world concerns of young people now.

Midnight Sun by Trish Cook

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Feb 8, 2018

Midnight Sun is heartbreaking and wonderful.

Recommended Young Adult titles to mark LGBT History Month 2018

Written by Sophie Green · Published Feb 7, 2018

This LGBT History Month, we've made our Young Adult LGBT recommendation list bigger and better than ever.

Moxie by Jennifer Mathieu

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Feb 6, 2018

Moxie is a powerful and brilliant book and real call to action.

Daughter of the Burning City by Amanda Foody

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jan 30, 2018

Daughter of the Burning City is an awe-inspiring and thrilling dark fantasy from a bold new voice in YA.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
